name: Glenn Dabbs
text: I live there. Right across the street and get this all the time.

name: Diana Steiner
text: Worked here ...

name: K Stuart
text: Not as good as buck creek 410, but otherwise and awsome lodge! Great work performed here!

name: Izz Noland
text: I really great group of people. I always feel welcome when visiting and have an instant connection with the brothers within the lodge. If you're a Hoover resident and interested in freemasonry, I highly suggest visiting on the first or third Monday of the month at 6p.

name: Allison Barry
text: DAR meeting place thanks to shriners!

name: Jennifer Wilson Coker
text: My husband and his father hunt there 3 times a year, Best place hands down Mr. Beers has got to be the best in the business...

name: Donald Hipp
text: Second year hunting here and already booked.for next season. If you want a great fair chase experience this camp gives you great opertunities for both trophy and non trophy animals. The owner and the guides do a great job trying to satisfy the hunters requests and needs. The cook does a good job, nothing fancy but tasty.and accommodations are comfortable.

name: Ziggy Zane
text:
We went for the dove shoot on opening day and it was great. Started with a warm up on skeet then ate an amazing lunch. The dove shoot itself was fun with a lot of action. The birds weren't as numerous as we had hoped but it could have been due to the storm that came through. My group averaged 8 birds a piece at the end of the day.

The lodge is nice but the mounts on display appear aged and could be updated. Over all it is evident that the people who run this place care about it and the hunts. On a side note, dont swim in the pond. There's a gator that likes to chill out under the tree.

name: Corey Mullis
text: Nice setup. Harvested a nice buck.

name: fred perley
text: Been hunting there for  about year grate people an grate hunting lots of good hunting a must go place see big deer

name: Happy Lady
text: Beautifully decorated lovely Place fantastic View

name: Eddie L Blocker jr
text: I gave it one star because you won't let me post until I say something I've never been to this place

name: Madison Allen
text: Absolutely beautiful! Came equipped with everything I needed for a great stay. Amazing customer service. I have never felt so comfortable outside of my own home. No noise or disturbances. I enjoyed all of the amenities being right in my room. The decor was beautiful and the king size bed was a plus! Wifi is included!

name: Mark Fore
text: Everything about my stay here was great. Very affordable and comfortable atmosphere. It immediately felt like home. Very neat , clean and beautifully decorated. Will definitely recommend to others and return if needed.

resp.text: Thank you very much, it was a pleasure  having you!😊

name: Cassandra Brown
text: My husband and I were fortunate to stay with Ms. Lambert at Glass Onion Suites for two months in 2018. The accommodations there are excellent. Ms.  Lambert has thought of everything to make you feel at home in her units. They are clean, completely equipped and nicely furnished as well as reasonably priced. Only place I would consider staying when in Selma.

name: Me Su
text: I absolutely love staying at this place.  It is very well maintained,  clean and  superbly decorated.  It is  like a real getaway.  I  would recommend it to everyone.  The most professional and kind property manager..

name: Brad Peters
text: I would give this more than 5 stars if I could.  I have stayed here two different times now and both times were perfect.  I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a place to stay while out of town on business or visiting family ect.  Carol “the owner” keeps these apartments very clean and she is a very professional and  personable.

name: Leroy Wright
text: It's the most beautiful place I've ever seen

resp.text: Thank you sir!! We aim to please 😊

name: Roderick Jackson
text: Great place, clean, quiet and in a great area. Very nice and helpful landlord. Only downside is tight parking, but is a great place, will try to stay there any time I can.

name: Robert Quinn
text: The room was Immaculate and very quiet. It felt like I was at home.

resp.text: Thank you very much! It was a pleasure having you  here.

name: sam williams
text: Very professional and helpful. Does a great job. I would recommend Glass Onion Suites to anybody.

name: Tracy Vaughn
text: Great location for peace after a long day at  work. Great person to lease from very attentive to your concerns

name: Shelia Hatcher
text: It is very spacious and beautifully decorated. The owner is very professional. It is a lovely and clean environment.

name: Terry Martinear
text: Nice, quiet cozy spot...No to far from Down Town , Ole Town and the attractions.

name: tommy richardson
text: Beautiful place loved the hospitality the owner is the perfect hostess

name: Joel carpenter
text: The honors dorm on campus. A great spot in the middle of everything.

name: Stephanie TheAnimeLover
text: Excellent place, I like this place.

name: Carson Elmore
text: The best dorm on Montevallo's campus. Worth all the work of the Honors Program just to get to live in Ramsay and have a fantastic college experience. Private bathroom with your roommate, rooms set up hotel style, and a great study lounge in the Basement.

name: Cassidy Acuff Williams
text: This place is much older but it is clean and quiet..

name: Holly Hewitt
text: It was clean and very easy to get to. The night desk man was very nice and the morning breakfast was cereal, waffles, juice, biscuits and gravy, fruit and yogurt. Being next to a main highway  I  was surprised the traffic wasn't louder. Stayed on a Monday night though. I'd stay here again

name: Izzy Clayborn
text: The rooms were nice and clean. The breakfast in the morning was way better then I thought it would be. It was overrall a great experience.

name: Kathleen Heather
text: I love the way their rooms are decorated. It has such a better feel than the older style hotel rooms that seem dark and dirty.

name: Brittany Victoria Kuenzel (TayKay's Mommy)
text: Very clean, affordable,  great staff ,and soo comfortable. .. me and an old friend met up the well remembered memories we will treasure forever

name: Carl Dodson
text: We stayed at this hotel on October 18th, 2014 and found it to be less than favorable conditions. The room my son and I stayed in was two full beds. The bathroom had one towel and smelled of urine. My father in law stayed in another room that had NO linens and NO towels. We brought this up to them the next morning and they stated that they only had 2 people to clean 17 rooms and that if they had the cash we would have received a full refund. Because no cash was on hand they said they'd mail us one. Well it came today. Apparently the disgusting rooms we stayed in were only worth a $15 refund on an $76 room. No matter how desperate I am, I would not chose this hotel to stay in again.

name: Mo Mo
text: Good service  clean room comfortable bed. Great place to stay

name: Timothy Williams
text: Nice hotel for the price. Smoking rooms available.  Microwave, fridge, and 36" TV in the room.

name: Kelli Cook
text: Love it, will stay here again

name: Jeremy Strickland
text: It was a very good hunting trip. This is a hunt not a go and shoot pigs in a fence. Mr Kieth is a top notch owner. Zach is a 23 yr old that cooks like he has been cooking in a top notch restaurant. I promise you this you wont go hungry. Plenty of pigs to shoot at. The secret is being there when they are. Thank you again for your hospitality Mr. Kieth and Zach thx for the full bellies.

resp.text: Thank you sir!

name: Brett Keeley
text: I have hunted alot of places. Hands down one of the best places I have been. My son and bother had a great time. Great conversations,food and lodging. They go over the top on making sure you are comfortable and killing hogs. We will be back and I would recommend them to anyone looking for a hog hunt. Thanks for a great time Keith and Zach!!!

resp.text: Thank you Sir! We really appreciate your business!

name: Scott Penton
text: Father and Son hunt 2020...Keith and his team provided the best hunting experience for me and my son. Their accommodations were perfect and their hospitality was even better. They made us feel like we were at home and never did we feel like we were just part of an outfit. My son harvested a deer and Keith had it processed by the time we left. Lots of good food, laughs, hunting, fishing and relaxing. What more could you ask for. We are booked again for 2021 and we can’t wait!

resp.text: Thank!

name: charles waterfield
text: I had a great time hunting Piney Woods. Keith is a great host, cook and man all around.  His crew are the best, very knowledgeable and entertaining. The property is second to none, from plots to deep woods. If anyone wants a great experience give them a call you will not be unhappy. Looking forward to next season and maybe some turkey hunting this spring.

resp.text: Thank you Sir!

name: Joseph Carter
text: We went last year on a hog hunt with Keith an l brought 9 guys on company hunting trip on 02-26-21. We’ve been a lot of places that say they have hogs but these guys really do, the first night we got 5 an the second night 4. Good people, good food, good times, already planning on coming back next year.

resp.text: Thanks!!!

name: Robert Czaplicki
text: Just spent 4 days with Keith, Zack, and Jamie at Piney Woods hunt lodge. Had a great time ! The food was perfect, exactly what you would expect from a hunting lodge. The sleeping arrangements where just a short 5 minute drive away from the lodge at the bunk house. There where plenty of stands we went to, they all had food plots and feeders located to give you a average 100-125 yard shot. The opportunity was there for me to harvest a nice deer but I failed to seal the deal. I will definitely be going back to hunt with Keith, Zack and Jamie again. Thanks again guys.

resp.text: Thank you Robert.   We enjoyed having you hunt with us.  Hope to see you again.   Thanks for the review.

name: Michael Halfacre
text: Keith goes out if his way to ensure you have a good hunting trip and plenty to eat!

resp.text: Thank you  sir!

name: Jason Carter
text: Hands-down best place to hunt hogs I have hunted all over he has tons of pigs great food and hospitality second to none Group of 9 we killed 9 hogs

resp.text: Thank you!  You guys are definitely killers! See you next trip.

name: James Hallford
text: I have hunted with Keith at Piney Woods a couple of times. You will not find any better people that the Wades. The lodge is wonderful and the cooking is is some of the south's finest. Keith and his crew go above and beyond to make sure your hunt is successful and memorable.

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Cory Compton
text: Piney Woods is an exceptional lodge. Mr Keith and his staff go above and beyond to provide the complete outdoor experience. Awesome hunting and fine southern cooking. We will definitely be coming back!

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Sherry Barnes
text: Great hunting, accommodations and the best home cooked meals I have ever had.   Mr. Keith Wade is a super guide and cook. Best tomatoe gravey in the south.

resp.text: Thank you very much!!!!!

name: Matt Towne
text: Great hunt, great host, 3 hogs in 3 days. Keith is straight up, worth the drive from Indiana. Looking forward to the next time..Go Notre Dame!

resp.text: Thank you for your business!  RTR!

name: Marlayna Wiley
text: If you want an amazing southern hunting experience then Piney Woods is your place! They treat you right. The hunts are great. Also, look to be well fed.

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Kenny Schell
text: Piney Woods put me on the largest hog I've ever shot, not to mention fed me well!  Will definitely be back.  Thanks Piney Woods Hunting Lodge for the great experience!

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Gregg Shannon
text: Going on my third year in a row of hunting here at the lodge and have shot game every time!  Last year I got two bucks in the same day one that scored 151 points with broken brow tines.  I have also hunted quail with both my dog and Keith's (the owner) dogs and had a blast.  I have hunted and killed several hogs and had them butchered by Keith's game processing in nearby Bunkerhill, AL.  Turkey is next on the hit list.  If you don't get game here then you have fell asleep in the box/stand.  Keith goes out of his way to be accommodating to all and will even discount or extend the hunt to folks who have not seen game to shoot. What more could you ask for?

resp.text: Thank you for your business and looking forward to seeing you and your team this year.

name: Morgan Strickland
text: I went to Piney Woods Lodge and did a tower shoot with them and got to waste some bullets at some pheasants, had a blast! Beautiful place and some great food and lodging to go with it:-)

resp.text: Thanks!  Come back to see us so we get a chance to raise our rating with you!!

name: Preston Davis
text: Had a great time at Piney Woods Hunting Lodge. Keith is a great cook and overall had a great experience.

resp.text: Thanks

name: Zachary Barnes
text: Great place for deer, bird, and hog hunting

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Leslie Cheatham
text: Beautiful and serene spot! I spent the weekend at the Honeywood Valley lodge with a group of friends from college and it could not have been more perfect for us! We hope to make this a yearly get together. We had plenty of space to relax and catch up outside and inside, when it rained. I highly recommend it for your next event!

resp.text: We are so happy you choose to spend your girls getaway at Honeywood Valley. We loved having you and look forward to being an annual retreat you and your friends!

name: Megan LaRussa Chenoweth
text: We had a wonderful weekend at Honeywood! It was such an easy, quick drive from Birmingham but when you get to the property you feel so much farther away as it's so peaceful! We loved just relaxing & enjoying the beautiful scenery.  And we couldn't resist getting some spa treatments from the ladies of Fancy Face. It was amazing, they came to the property for the spa treatments so we didn't have to go anywhere! All in all it was a truly relaxing & rejuvenating weekend & we can't wait to go back!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing to spend your time at Honeywood Valley. We are so happy to hear you had a wonderful time and look forward to having you back anytime.

name: True40 Downtown Birmingham
text: We took a staff wellness retreat at Honeywood, and it was beyond incredible. The property and house are so beautiful, that you can be completely happy just sitting and relaxing for the duration of the stay, but Honeywood provides so many activities and amenities. We took a barre class in the barn, yoga on the deck, and enjoyed water activities like paddle boarding, canoeing, and kayaking. We spent sunset with wine watching the sunset on the expansive deck. There was plenty of space to sleep comfortably and privately. Honeywood would be an ideal venue for a number of different trips: a girls weekend, family getaway, corporate retreat, wedding, and more. You can make Honeywood your own while you're there, and we were so impressed.

resp.text: We are so happy to share this slice of heaven with you! It gives us such joy that you all were able to relax, retreat and spend time with your team growing, sweating and being in fellowship together. We are extremely thankful and grateful that you all enjoyed your stay with us at Honeywood!

name: Lynda Ratliff
text: Honeywood Valley is such a serene and peaceful place to go, unwind and truly rejuvenate. The accommodations are very well appointed with gorgeous rooms, plenty of space and everything you need for a true retreat.

resp.text: Lynda, thank you so much for your feedback. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay.

name: Zach Plunket
text: Amazing venue and great people. The entire property is well kept, managed and beautiful. Didn’t account for how far away it would be from any gas stations and I ran out of gas. One of the owners brought out a personal gas can and put 5 gallons in my vehicle.

resp.text: We were glad to have you! Hate to hear you ran out of gas, but we are happy to hear our team was there to assist when needed. Come back and see us again soon!

name: Allie Tittle
text: Hands down the most beautiful wedding venue I’ve ever been to! The views were incredible, the management and staff were extremely friendly, and the property was immaculate. 10/10!

resp.text: Thank you for your amazing review! We hope you come back to see us again soon!

name: Gaynell Tate
text: It was one of the most peaceful places I ever experienced

resp.text: We are so glad to hear that! We hope you come back to see us again soon!

name: Brandon Broach
text:
Yellow Branch is an amazing place. We’ve visited before for weddings and also come corporate events and every time it takes my breath away.  The owners are so gracious in sharing this little piece of heaven with others.

Watching the sunset from the deck or balcony over the lake just feeds my soul.

The hilltop barn is a refuge within a refuge. It’s a great place for reflection and quiet.

It truly is a gem in the Alabama hills.

name: Stephanie Brumbeloe
text: If you are looking for a unique wedding venue at a place that everyone will be excited about getting an invitation to, then Yellow Branch is the place for you. Just one wedding per weekend and you have the place all to yourself. An experience you and your guests will never forget! It's worth every penny!

name: Gina McGiboney
text: Gorgeous scenery and hospitable owners!  Wonderful location for weddings, family reunions,  or business retreats!

name: Thomas Nails
text: Beautiful place, wonderful staff. Very vendor friendly.

name: Suanne Nutter
text: Beautiful venue and nice people.

name: Michael Sides
text: Beautiful property, gorgeous house, better views.

name: Robert Frazier
text: Beautiful location

name: Jonathan Bates
text: This place is one of Alabama's "Hidden Gems"!!!  Simply beautiful!!

name: Rick Slater
text: Checked in by 230 and was told no rooms on first floor available,. Ice machine still not working, rugs in lobby soiled pretty good, pool looks green, I walked around the building first floor, looked like at least 8 rooms were being used for storage and or maybe going to renovated

name: Tevis Team (TevisTeam)
text: Water was kinda week but nice stay

name: Valentina R
text: Great value for your money.  The room was clean and quiet. Convenient location.  We and our dog enjoyed our stay.

name: Heidy Beaty
text: The place need a good cleaning walls, doors and carpet. Didn't see any bugs or any sign off them. So that was good.  Said breakfast there wasn't one.

name: Kara Whittington
text:
I am very picky about hotels and never really like them.. this place was very clean(to my surprise!). The shower curtain had to be freshly washed. As soon as I pulled the shower curtain back, you could smell detergent on it, in the air.
The wash clothes and towels had a little smell of bleach to them, which I love because that means they have been cleaned! I have no complaint about this Motel!!

name: Scott Patterson
text: We weren't too sure about this place at first. It looked a outdated compared to the newer hotels nearby. Once we got to the room, we found that it was clean, and smelled nice. There was a plumbing problem, which the staff took care of promptly. They were also very friendly. The pool looked alright, although we didn't get in it. They had a small breakfast in the lobby, and we had some delicious muffins. Overall, a surprisingly nice little hotel.

name: Hitesh Joshi
text: excellent service by staff, very good environment.... Room are pretty clean i am very happy to stay here i will come here again defiantly..and the most important thing is very cheap than other motels.

name: PINTOS PATTRELS
text: Very clean an has very nice associates an very reasonable rates

name: Ashish Patel
text: Very clean an has very nice associates an very reasonable rates nd also very helpful staff i be back in next time

name: Troy Reaves
text: I wrote a previous review because they worked me and wouldn't pay me anything and they knew that I wanted to be there with my wife so they played off of that and so it was work for free or get out. They would get mad at the girl at the front desk and take it out on me telling me to leave the property or get put in jail. Well then they calm down and want me to stay but they treated me very badly. Jay and Mona the owners at one point had 10 flooded rooms down stairs and they were full of mold and had no carpet in them but still said I had to pay 65 a day or work for just the room up at all hours of the night. Marvin the guy up there at this present time came to me the last time I stopped to see my wife because I had been for a couple of days to see my kids because my kids weren't allowed to visit with me there and Marvin told me to get off the property or I would be arrested. My mother came by at one point with my children to bring me some groceries and Mona got mad and said I had to many people in the room. They were just dropping off groceries. I was accused of stealing from them and when they found the tools they accused me of stealing in the owner Jay's van never once did I get an apology and in the end they ended up ruining the relationship between me and my wife and I've lost her due to everything that took place because of them. Marvin is very racist because I was talking to some black rappers that were passing through town and got a room and while I was talking to them Marvin comes out assuming it's a drug deal. So I would not recommend this hotel to anyone . spend a few extra dollars and get a good hotel room.

name: Yo Christian
text: Beautiful rooms and very friendly staff, will definitely be staying here again.

name: jon mayeur
text: Rooms were clean the sat went out for a while but come to find out the was a tornado right down the street so u cant really blame them for that. The staff was nice and the breakfast was ok too.

name: Horace Little
text: The room was clean and ready for me when I arrived. Door had a slight problem which was repaired right away. I was somewhat disappointed with the breakfast however considering my last two stays were at a Marriott and Double Tree I should not have been. The room served my purpose as I only needed a place to sleep and I booked through AARP and got a really good price. so you get what you pay for. The room was clean and I am an Environmental Services Manager.

name: Aunteejudy Taylor
text: Newly updated. Reasonable price

name: Hunter Knight
text: Was a nice place to lay my head for the night. Plenty of towels for bathroom use, clean beds, and an amazing price!

name: Judy Ritchie
text: We found the accommodation quite comfortable. Was a little surprised that there was no hair dryer. And, we were quite perturbed that there was a $15 per fee. Ee travelled from Nova Scotia a d was on the road for 5 nights. At no other accommodation were we charged for our dog (11 lb shiz tzu). It seems to me that charging a pet fee is just a money grab as the rooms used are repetitive for pets with little extra  cleaning required, especially for smaller animals.

name: walter golden
text: Room was loud from the noise being made by the heater. The floor was cold due to lack of carpet and it was sounded like popcorn as my dog walked over it. Not any additional blankets available.

name: Amanda Stone
text: Very clean an has very nice associates an very reasonable rates

name: Betty Taylor
text: This place looks good from the outside and in the lobby but it's NOT   the room we had reeked of smoke, the carpet was threadbare, the mattress top was torn from the bottom, and the comforter was dirty while the sheets had stains on them. Would NOT stay here again. Most unpleasant experience

name: Michael Mincey
text: Good for a last minute overnight stop. Rooms are clean but dated. Breakfast is so so.

name: AUTUMN CRAM
text: Rooms were incredibly disgusting we checked and there were stains on the comforter holes in the comforter the room reeked of chemicals so bad my daughter continued coughing after about 40 minutes we went down to the front Jaske these initialed and signed the paperwork the receipt saying full refund give me the managers name called the manager and the manager said no we don't give refunds you stayed here for so you pay for it I'm completely rude obnoxious the most disgusting hotel I've ever seen I wouldn't run it ever warn everybody about seeing away from this pit and the management

name: Jan & Hope McCrary
text: We stayed in Room 222 on 6/17/16 Rates were inflated for the room. We paid $103.00 with tax for this room which should have been no more than the advertised price of $65.00.  Bathroom fan sounded like it was going to fall out of the ceiling, stains on the wall, floor on bathroom was filthy.  Stains on carpet throughout but mainly around trashcans.  The person named Patel that gave this a 5 star review....ironic that the owner is named Patel.

name: Paula Brock
text: Great rooms. Friendly staff members and great southern hospitality!!

name: Latashia Perdue
text: I can not give this place any stars because that's how terrible the stay was.  First off when we arrived to check in there were about 4 or 5 guys in the parking just hanging out, only to find out that they were in the room next to us. Coming from Detroit it looked kind of suspicious, like may be they were selling drugs or something. The room itself was not the best. There were burn marks on the bedspread and the night stand. There was also a strange odor. We stayed because it was cheap and they had already charged my card for 2 nights. The ice machine was broke and look like something out of a horror film. We stayed 2 days without the room being cleaned or any garbage bags or tissue so we bought our own. I called the front desk to get a noon check out and was rudely told NO by a white guy posing as the manager. So we left at 11 and by 1:00 my card was charged an additional $50 for a cleaning fee. First of all when do hotels start charging for a free service. The room was already a smoking room so there is no charge for that. We stayed 2 days and did not have the thrash changed or given any bags for thrash. I threw all of my garbage in the thrash can and tried to straighten the room up as best as I could but after Mr Manager rudely told me to get out I did not clean the room since you have a housekeeping department for that. I WILL NEVER stay in this hotel again.

name: Bruce Alfrejd
text: No room service no breakfast ,,ugly stay

name: Jason Hoover
text: Ok room, comfortable beds, not big on grass bugs that keep getting into room from close by factory

name: Michael Blackmon
text: Clean rooms, friendly service and great rate

name: Virginia Carol Yarbrough
text:
Their rooms are not clean they are dusty, they have old furniture, and smell like mold.    Please look at the room before you give them your credit card and ID. they have mold.  I rented the room, used the bathroom, when I came back he had already ran the card.  Left there went to Wal-Mart and then to KFC came back to the room could not stand the order. And could not sit in the chairs for the animal hair..  Told the young lady at the office dhe tried to find another room they all smelled like mold.  She called Gary and told him that I could not stay.  He said he was own his way and I had to pay for the night.  I ask him why because I'm  not staying because I can't  breath  and it smell of mold  and it's
interfering with my breathing, he didn't  care.  He told me I had to pay for the night, he charged me anyway.  Mona is the owner tgey called her and she told the employee to charge me for one night, even though I didn't  stay.  My bible tells me you reap what you sow.  I'm not telling anyone not to go there I'm just saying, I can't.   Thanks to the young Lady that tried to find another room for me but they all smelled like mold.  You I are very nice keep up the good work.

name: Ethel Duffey
text: It was affordable and close to my job where I was working that day.

name: Chassey Wooten
text: Rooms are clean and we'll stocked with toiletries. They are reasonable price and close to all restaurants and stores.

name: Rob Wells
text: Nice amenities

name: pragnesh patel
text: Nice and clean room,I really enjoyed my stay friendly staff

name: Woo Chang Kim
text: Website stated that there was a gym. Gym is used as a storage and not available. There was urine stain on my toilet seat, which means the toilet was not cleaned. Faucet handle was broken. There was a guy urinating in the stairway. Tried to call the front desk to notify her of the guy urinating, then realized that the phone doesn’t even work. All around probably the worse inn/motel experience ever.

name: Guy Saintil
text: Nice place to lay your head

name: Pamela Alexander
text: Well the location is great!! Put us n a room, where the TV did not pu any channels listed,, so the lady offered to move us, she also just straightened up the beds we had been sitting on waiting for the next customer,,BS, the room we were moved to was filthy!! The microwave and the front of the frig had never been wiped off!! The tray that holds the ice bucket was very dusty as well, I know im a smoker,  but take pride and wipe ur doors off, clean the grease off the wall beside the bed?  IKR ? I even cleaned the tiolet seat w/soap and water bc it did not feel clean, the best part, were the nrds. They slept very well, I would not recommend this dump to no one!!

name: Leatrice Jarvis
text: Great service, friendly staff, will definitely come again.

name: Debbie Mcdaniel
text: Must see pics.  This would be a bad rent by the hour hotel

name: Damon Moritz
text: What a hole. Avoid. Even at these prices this place is gawd awful. Stained sheets, slimy pool and doors that don't lock.

name: Sheenat3 !
text: Good enough for one night

name: George Baston
text: Good, inexpensive place to stay. Friendly staff.

name: Bob Reu
text: Well lit.  Nice folks work there. Clean.

name: ? Mr. Anonymous
text: Trashy hotel bad service and almost everything is outdated

name: Angie Hollis
text: Bathroom door and exterior door had to be slammed and pushed so they would close.  Refrigerator didn't work.

name: john merritt
text: Booked a room here and drove 9hrs to get here and they are closed. Not permanently but just for the night, had people already there staying and nobody working!! How does that happen?

name: Terry Arkins
text: Can’t believe Wyndham would have its name attached to the ghetto property. We called our experience to Wyndham and received no response

name: Lareesa Garza
text: Convenient, clean

name: Troy Reaves
text: Not a healthy place for families to stay. Very nasty

name: Brody Frederick
text: Never staying again. Rooms were dirty and had blood stains on floor.

name: Duvall Edwards
text: Friendly staff but room need a lot of work.

name: Tanya Black
text: Clean,walking distance to Wal-Mart and other stores

name: Richard Ballenger
text: My date noticed her feet were black on the bottom I took a towel and rubbed it on the floor see picture filthy dirty probably the worst Motel we stayed in and quite some time Greenville Alabama

name: Tanya Black Young
text: Clean but staff will steal

name: Walt Turner
text: Nasty. Toilet didnt even have water hooked up.I would not ever stay again.Breakfast was a joke.

name: Joanna Sanders
text: Absolutely wonderful

name: Alex S
text: There were fights alcohol drugs and fights and sketchey over all

name: Everett genereux
text: Hope i can find another place to stay when i pass though Greenville Alabama, Not a good place to stay

name: Angela Krelle
text: Had to fix the TV myself. Desk person was rude

name: Robert Bailey
text:
A long day at work then have to put UP with kid's at the same time . OVER WITH BOUT TO GET MY MIND AND SPIRITRIGHT FOR MYSELF ONCE LOOK OUT WORLD I'M COMING
#########$$$$!! $!*^/#! $!@####

name: Robert Bailey
text:

name: Ashley Clem
text: Everyone is always so kind and welcoming. Our daughter loves visiting with us and everyone treats us so sweetly.

name: Gary Watkins
text: Great place and really good people

name: Everly Cora
text: great people

name: Andrew Barnett
text: It's ok, probably was better back in the days I guess.

name: Damian Scott
text: It's a nice place to have a Wedding Anniversary party or a reception. It have plenty of room and a kitchen.

name: Wendy Thomas

name: Carl James
text: Decent.. The show was terrible. Erealist Comedy show the show was trash  not worth the 35 dollar Ripoff you had more people in your entourage than the whole city. The DJ was the best thing going not one funny moment in whole evening and your warmup guy is bad engery  plus he's not funny didn't have a clue who his audience was

name: Chisa Calloway
text: Known as a Faternal Order of Police building but also known for holding 25-up gatherings

name: Janice Foreman
text: nice party place

name: kelvin james
text: Horrible and cold inside

name: Jackie Harris
text: I don't know what to say

name: Rabbitt Staib
text: First time, good time. The entire team here at Cameron was very accommodating the food was great the hunts were excellent. Plenty of quail, and everyone in my group was quite satisfied. Nice meeting area in the back with a fire pit. I really can't say enough about this place. Jonathan taught me quite a lot, and everybody was very safety-minded. I really can't wait to come back here again. I highly recommend this place.

name: Clayton Hudson
text: Fantastic hunting

name: Randy Richesin
text: Had a wonderful hunt everyone so nice; food was amazing ;

name: Charles Hollingshead
text: Great hunting,great staff,and great fun for the family young and old

name: Bill Blair
text: This place is first class in every way. I'm almost 73 years old, and I've been bird hunting since I was too young to carry a gun. I'd follow my daddy, and I'd usually find a good stick to carry, and for a 7 year old, that and my imagination was all I needed. At Cameron's, there are so many very large coveys of quail, it is nearly impossible to estimate how many birds we found. The pointing dogs were very good, and the Boykin spaniels were an absolute pleasure to have there to work for us.  Oh, and we can't forget the meals we had prepared for us. Breakfast and lunch were absolutely delicious. The best quail and gravy I have ever eaten. Great family owned and operated business. They made me feel like I was family. I told our guide that that day of hunting was the most fun that I had ever had with my clothes on!

name: Isaac Russell
text: Good place

resp.text: thanks ole buddy

name: Chad Kozlowski
text: Thanks again to Cameron Quail Farms for another great hunt this year. My (83 year old) Grandfather and I have visited back to back years and have enjoyed a great hunting experienced in a Family environment. The Cameron family and their staff are amazing people and will treat you like one of their own. Five star hunting, lodging, food, experience and more.

name: Leighton Boggs
text: Great good time!  Killed alot of birds, ate some amazing food and made some good memories. We are sitting by the fire telling stories now. 35 degrees

name: Brandon McCurry
text: Not quiet sure what these people do behind closed doors but they have a great pancake day breakfast

name: Kevin Bardy
text: Awesome

name: R M
text:
My dad and I went out and did an archery hunt with Wayne and his team. We immediately felt like part of the family and really enjoyed the hunting. We will definitely return for another hunt.

-Richard

name: Cool Change Outdoors
text: We hunted this place last year and had a decent trip but didn’t see any deer that qualified for their size rules so we decided to give it another try this year on a better week during the rut. This year the place was full with 14 hunters and we were rotated through The same unproductive stands over and over throughout our four-day trip seeing the same small deer. When we asked the guide in the mornings what the plan was for the day they told us they had no idea which let us to believe there was very little scouting or planning for our group. Day three with heavy rains expected we were put in open tree stands with no cover and when we called to be picked up they were unresponsive and we had to walk a mile and a half out on our own. They had us hunting out of on maintained box blinds and ripped and torn ground blinds that looked like they were 10 years old. Last year we had home cooked meals for lunch and dinner this year we got fast food Popeyes chicken sandwiches and order our pizza. Not the type of service you’d expect for $1800 per person. Do yourself a favor stay clear of this place

name: Gary Jones
text: Tks for the honest review Cool Change. I crossed this place off my list.

name: Sam Decker
text: Do not take your kids to this lodge. They are not safe there.

name: Deanmu6uio Paulin
text:
This is the first time I have used a professional hunting service.
The lodge was really nice. The food was great. The Curtis family and my guide Jeff really took care of me.
Saw at least 52 turkeys and lots of deer. I passed on shooting an 8 pt.
Going back in January.
I can't wait. I highly recommend the place.

name: Mel Shrader
text: Great visit in January. Saw plenty of game and the outfitter was great. Lodge was top notch and the limited number of hunters made for a great hunt.

name: Sean Word
text:
Absolutely a GREAT TIME!!! Will and his family offer a great place with wonderful hospitality..Mrs Curtis cooks the BEST meals!!! Will has a great hunting area ..very well managed and BEAUTIFUL land..LOTS OF DEER!!! Thanks for a wonderful time

Sean Word
Griffin GA

name: Pam Kirkland
text: Great people, beautiful place!!

name: Leon McClellan
text: Great place!  Absolutely love the Curtis family!

name: george Horshok
text: I had a very positive experience.  Will Curtis went out of his way to accomidate a last minute hunt for me.  I saw around 90 deer in 2 1/2 days.  Approximately 30 bucks.  The other guys in camp had similar numbers of deer seen.  This is a trophy hunt.  I wanted to kill a big buck, so i passed on a lot of deer.  This was a mid december hunt.  So, the really big bucks were moving at dark.  I didnt kill a deer, but that was my decision.  I will go back

name: Shay Carnley
text: Amazing place!!!

name: Damon Blythe
text: Great family run operation!

name: Brian Ames
text: Lodging and food are good, the hunting was horrible.

name: Jon Box
text: Outstanding staff, A-1 activities, excellent cooking fare, and the Word of God; you can't beat that!

name: Garrett Totcky
text: An amazing retreat. Incredibly beautiful!

name: Blake Hargrove
text: This place is absolutely wonderful. The newer Lodge is HUGE, and full with amenities. It is a great place to get away and relax, recreate, and slow down. Highly recommend going here!

name: Timothy Francis
text: Wonderful place to retreat! Great for youth groups.

name: Phyllis Harris
text: Beautiful and peaceful setting and no detail was overlooked when it comes to comfort!

name: Stan Gunselman
text: Beautiful facility and extremely friendly staff. Wonderful place for group gatherings. The dinner was like a delicious home-cooked meal. I highly recommend this event venue.

name: Andrew Walker
text: Really great activities and a really great location. Clean amd well kept bunk houses and dining areas made for a easy and relaxing experience.

name: Ashley Elmore
text: The owners, managers, and staff are so friendly and helpful. The new addition is absolutely beautiful, homey, and comfortable. Great place for a church retreat, family reunion, or other weekend gathering.

name: Andres Martinez
